title.value: Specialty Rx Data Source Capability Statement

description.value: This CapabilityStatement describes the expected capabilities of a server that is capable of responding to a Specialty Rx Request (CommunicationRequest) posted with the `$process-message` operation. The server may also support an unsolicited deliver of a Specialty Rx Data Response (Communication)

documentation.value: Specialty Rx Data Source **SHALL**: 1. Support the Solicited workflow defined in this Guide in the [Message Flow Using CDex](cdex-message-flow.html) section and respond to the $process-message operation described in [Message Submission](submission.html). 2. Implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification. 3. Support the json source format. 4. Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the profiles supported. Specialty Rx Data Source **SHOULD**: 1. Support the xml source format. 2. Identify the Specialty Rx profiles supported as part of the FHIR `meta.profile` attribute for each instance. The Specialty Rx Data Source MAY support the Unsolicited workflow defined in this Guide in [Message Flow Using CDex](cdex-message-flow.html)

description.value: 1. For general security consideration refer to the FHIR Security and Privacy Considerations (http://build.fhir.org/secpriv-module.html). A server **SHALL** reject any unauthorized requests by returning an `HTTP 401` unauthorized response code.
